Html:
Hi Stephane,

i'm creating some 3d videos and it works great with your player. But it would be really nice if you could you add some command line options like:

-play path/file
-loop (a loop button would be also cool)
-directshow/vlc
-settings file (for predefined settings)
-adapter X (like in unity you can choose the monitor where the player gets displayed)
...
.

So it would be possible to start the video without fiddling too much in the settings..

Thanks for your work!
-Dreymo

Hi Dreymo,

Thank you for your feedback.

Currently vrplayer can be launched with 2 parameters: the file name and a preset file.
(e.g: vrplayer.exe "c:\movie.mp4" "c:\preset.json")
Note: if you don't specify a preset file, the player will look for the file name + ".json"
(e.g: c:\movie.mp4.json) unless the option has been desactivated in the general options panel

I will add this information to the user documentation.

Also, there is a loop button at the bottom right of the screen (next to the time bar) but it look like a refresh button :S

I was thinking about including application configuration (loop, default monitor and other options like shortcuts) in preset file but I changed my mind because I did not want users to upload app configs to vrplayer.tv and mess-up settings specific to users. Using command line seems to be a good idea so I added it to the backlog and see what we can do.

Best regards,

-Stephane
